```{r}
library(mlbench)
library(purrr)
library(xgboost)
library(dplyr)
library(caret)
```

```{r}
data("PimaIndiansDiabetes2")
ds <- as.data.frame(na.omit(PimaIndiansDiabetes2))
## fit a logistic regression model to obtain a parametric equation
logmodel <- glm(diabetes ~ .,
                data = ds,
                family = "binomial")
summary(logmodel)

cfs <- coefficients(logmodel) ## extract the coefficients
prednames <- variable.names(ds)[-9] ## fetch the names of predictors in a vector
prednames

sz <- 100000000 ## to be used in sampling
##sample(ds$pregnant, size = sz, replace = T)

dfdata <- map_dfc(prednames,
                  function(nm){ ## function to create a sample-with-replacement for each pred.
                    eval(parse(text = paste0("sample(ds$",nm,
                                             ", size = sz, replace = T)")))
                  }) ## map the sample-generator on to the vector of predictors
## and combine them into a dataframe

names(dfdata) <- prednames
dfdata

class(cfs[2:length(cfs)])

length(cfs)
length(prednames)
## Next, compute the logit values
pvec <- map((1:8),
            function(pnum){
              cfs[pnum+1] * eval(parse(text = paste0("dfdata$",
                                                     prednames[pnum])))
            }) %>% ## create beta[i] * x[i]
  reduce(`+`) + ## sum(beta[i] * x[i])
  cfs[1] ## add the intercept

## exponentiate the logit to obtain probability values of thee outcome variable
dfdata$outcome <- ifelse(1/(1 + exp(-(pvec))) > 0.5,
                         1, 0)

```

```{r}
# List to store results
results <- data.frame(Method = character(),
                      DatasetSize = integer(),
                      TestAccuracy = numeric(),
                      TimeTakenSecs = numeric(),
                      stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

# Set random seed
set.seed(123)
sizes <- c(100, 1000, 10000, 100000, 1000000, 10000000)

for (sz in sizes) {
  df_sample <- dfdata %>% sample_n(sz)
  train_idx <- sample(1:sz, size = 0.8 * sz)
  train_data <- df_sample[train_idx, ]
  test_data <- df_sample[-train_idx, ]
  dtrain <- xgb.DMatrix(data = as.matrix(train_data %>% select(-outcome)),
                        label = train_data$outcome)
  dtest <- xgb.DMatrix(data = as.matrix(test_data %>% select(-outcome)),
                       label = test_data$outcome)
  start_time <- Sys.time()
  model <- xgboost(data = dtrain,
                   max.depth = 3,
                   eta = 0.1,
                   nrounds = 50,
                   objective = "binary:logistic",
                   verbose = 0)
  end_time <- Sys.time()
  preds <- predict(model, dtest)
  pred_labels <- ifelse(preds > 0.5, 1, 0)
  accuracy <- mean(pred_labels == test_data$outcome)
  results <- rbind(results,
                   data.frame(Method = "XGBoost",
                              DatasetSize = sz,
                              TestAccuracy = accuracy,
                              TimeTakenSecs = as.numeric(difftime(end_time, start_time, units = "secs")),
                              stringsAsFactors = FALSE))
  
  cat("Finished size:", sz, "\n")
}

print(results)
```

```{r}
# List to store results
results_caret <- data.frame(Method = character(),
                            DatasetSize = integer(),
                            CVAccuracy = numeric(),
                            TimeTakenSecs = numeric(),
                            stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

# Set random seed
set.seed(123)

# Sizes you want to test
sizes <- c(100, 1000, 10000, 100000, 1000000, 10000000)

for (sz in sizes) {
  
  # Sample the dataset
  df_sample <- dfdata %>% sample_n(sz)
  df_sample$outcome <- as.factor(df_sample$outcome)  # **FIX: make outcome a factor**
  
  # Create training control with 5-fold CV
  train_control <- trainControl(method = "cv", number = 5)
  
  # Start timing
  start_time <- Sys.time()
  
  # Train XGBoost model via caret
  model <- train(outcome ~ .,
                 data = df_sample,
                 method = "xgbTree",
                 trControl = train_control,
                 tuneLength = 3,
                 verbose = FALSE)
  
  # End timing
  end_time <- Sys.time()
  
  # Extract the best accuracy from cross-validation
  best_accuracy <- max(model$results$Accuracy)
  
  # Record the results
  results_caret <- rbind(results_caret,
                         data.frame(Method = "XGBoost (caret 5-fold CV)",
                                    DatasetSize = sz,
                                    CVAccuracy = best_accuracy,
                                    TimeTakenSecs = as.numeric(difftime(end_time, start_time, units = "secs")),
                                    stringsAsFactors = FALSE))
  
  cat("Finished size:", sz, "\n")
}

# Show the results
print(results_caret)
```
